Text:
I'm impressed. That's right, we were the ones who
ransacked this village.

Several figures step forward, amongst them a man who
appears to be their leader.

We are the "possessed"! Even the lords tremble at
the mention of our name.

The filthy-looking bandits continue blabbering on
without further prompting.

I get it...of course it's the work of the possessed.
Hahah... You've named your group of bandits
the "possessed."
Wonder what brings you back here?

Well, of course, to extort brave halfwits like you who
show up to scavenge the corpses.

Not that we expected you to be "half-width" in size as
well!
Sigh...

As the bandits roar with laughter, I let out an
involuntary sigh.
Got a problem, missy?
Of course. There's no saving idiots like you.
As I see it, you're the only brave halfwits here.

Everyone eyes the "possessed" with contempt. Their
feigned unconcern is itself a form of concern.

These bandits have no clue about the treacherous
situation they're stepping into.
The hell did you just say?!

Your pretty face will fetch a high price after we've
had our fun with you!
Why do you villains always spout the same lines?

Even as I express my disgust, I use my gaze to give
Beta and Zeta orders.
I can handle the vanguard. Beta, you cover our flank.
Understood.
Hyaaah!
Weak!
Aaagh!

A concerted attackâ€”but, having built up hours of
combat training, this poses no threat to me.
Heh!
Aaaghhh!!!

One by one, I reduce their numbers. Here, however,
the bandits change tactics.
Hey! Forget her! Aim for that scrawny one in back!
Got it, boss!

The leader barks orders and a gun is added to the
fray.
Damn it...

Shooting into the dark provides little accuracy,
but the unpredictability makes it that much
harder to evade.
Beta!

Where do you think you're looking? You're all mine,
girly! Hee hee hee!
Tsk, out of my way! I've got to help her...

This is bad. Beta still lacks hands-on experience.
It's one thing to evade your enemy by picking up
on their patterns, but attacks with limited range
are tough to counter.
How do I dodge themâ€”
Don't think! Just move!

It's not working. Beta's mind is frozen. The bullet
flies straight towards her chestâ€”
Nope, not happening.
Zeta...
Here. Right back at you.
Aghhhâ€”

Zeta nimbly hurls a slime dagger into the darkness.
It flies with deadly accuracy and lodges itself in the
throat of the gunman.
Well done, Zeta.

...Wait, should I be transforming it into a circular
blade if I'm using it as a throwing knife?

Zeta joins me in the vanguard, using her daggers to
cut down the incoming bullets.
Agh... H-How the hell are they so strongâ€”

In the end, thanks to Zeta's help, we easily wipe out
the bandits.
...Great job.

After ensuring we've annihilated all the bandits,
I confirm that Beta is safe before thanking Zeta.

No need to thank me, but there's something I should
mention to you.

It must be something to do with my orders. I bite my
lower lip and nod.

Your orders are sound, but they're a little too
sound.
Too sound...

They're predictable, almost as much as the bandit's
throwaway lines.

On top of that, you try to manage everything on your
own.

She's right. I'm essentially in charge of the Shadow
Gardenâ€”that responsibility has been unconsciously
weighing heavily on me.

You see, Lady Alpha, villains like these bandits are far
stupider and more cowardly than you. They'll come up
with tricks you can't even imagine.

If you freeze up and stand around scratching your
head...you'll end up dead.

Neither Beta nor I can say anything in reply. Zeta is
rightâ€”we were unprepared.

...I'll become stronger. Strong enough that, next
time, I won't freeze up.

It's Beta who recovers first. She declares these
words in a frustrated yet firm voice.

I find myself encouraged by Beta's words. I must
learn from her example.

You're right. I meant to use this opportunity to
enhance our teamwork and increase Beta's
combat experience.

But I've discovered other areas I need to work on as
wellâ€”trusting others and adapting to various combat
scenarios.

Don't worry about it. I'll be relying on you when I'm
the one that messes up.

Zeta's reply is apologetic, but I know her earlier
advice was only meant to help us.
She really is part of our family, after all.
Now then, all that's left to do isâ€”

As I consider whether we should withdraw or wait for
the Cult to catch wind of the rumors...
Ughh...
